channel.title: healthTest
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from healthTest, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 'Cancer doesn't care': Patients pushed past divisive politics to lobby Congress

item.title: Some ant architects design a colony to cut the risk of disease. Humans, take note!
item.description: One kind of tiny ant can serve as a monumental example for how to keep members of a community safe from pathogens. A new study shows how they do it.

item.title: Age 2.5 Emerges as Earliest Effective Screening Age for Developmental Language Disorder

item.title: Last year's flu season was California's worst in years: How bad will this one get?
item.description: Last year's flu season was the worst California had seen in years—and state health officials warn this year could potentially be just as bad.
